for example say you have like one share of Google say it costs $100 but a call option only cost $5 well then you could sell the stock and buy the option instead for that smaller amount and thus you're lowering your downside risk to only $5 instead of $100 and of course that option could still become worthless if Google never reaches is a strike price by the expiration date that's a whole different topic about the unique risks of options trading but in this particular case the pif is essentially using them to just kind of really the main thing you should take away is that they're using them to lower the amount that they have invested in stocks without being completely left out of them if they happen to rise later on they'll be able to buy back in using these call options but uh with that in mind how much did they actually sell out of these stocks and how much did they buy with call options well even with the options well it was still a giant amount of selling and still pretty close to half of their entire portfolio in fact according to their filing the total stock portfolio the value of it fell from over 35 billion dollar down to around 20 billion so that's about a 42% decline even including the new options that they added on and when looking at those options I mean you can see how small they are by comparison so for example they sold over a million shares of adobe but only added back a few 100,000 in call options which by the way those aren't actually like real shares that they own it's just the option to buy that many shares later on and with AMD they sold over 4 million while adding back 1 million in options Amazon they sold over 4 million uh and added back 1.5 million CRM they sold 2.6 million and added back half a million Google they sold over 4 million and added back less than 1 million meta sold over 2.5 million and added back only a couple hundred, and Microsoft sold close to 2 million while adding back only a few 100,000 shares worth of call options and then here's just a video recording that I made of everything sorted by the amount of shares that they sold and you can see just like the massive amount of selling here most of these being complete exits of the positions but you can see millions and really billions of dollars sold of popular stocks like Carnival next era energy Starbucks PayPal AMD Zoom Google Amazon JP Morgan Chase meta American Tower Microsoft Home Depot Adobe Black Rock Walmart and many more
